chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs).228 and OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs).228 and the other charge, OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) was dismissed by the court.

  • Mark M. Geboy was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs).228, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(b).
  • Mark M. Geboy was found guilty of Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).
  • Mark M. Geboy was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Associated with Charge #2

3:29 P.M. Defendant Mark M. Geboy in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Bednar/Hogan/Defendant/Court statement to sentencing. 
Court Sentence

Count 2
Driver's License revocation - 3 years
IID - 12 months
Jail - Conditional - 9 months with Huber for all purposes
Jail credit - 39 days (includes time spent at Koinonia)
WHS/POP - 3 yrs
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
DNA Sample
$2000 fine (includes costs)
Community Service - 50 hours
AODA assessment and recovery
Maintain absolute sobriety 
Probation agent to contact Court regarding authorization of 4-day furlough for job search
Jail credit - if revoked - 13 days
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO.

Count 3
Fine of $100 plus costs

Count 4 
9 months concurrent with Count 2
State's Exhbits 1 - 4

Defendant Mark M. Geboy in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
1:04 - back on record - state offers exhibit 4 -(Cert copy of bond form ) received - off record for video appr to be set up - 1:18- Jurors in 
State calls R.P. via video - sworn by Court /direct - state offers exhibits 2 and 3 (lab results) /cross/Redirect exhibits received - State rests
Defense calls Mark Geboy/sworn/Direct - juror has statement - continue with cross examination - 
State calls R.P via video as rebuttal - Direct/Cross - 
2:42 - Jurors out - instruction discussion with counsel - 100,2669,2620,140,145,103,162 with addition,170,157,155,148,190,195,300,200,327,325,160,465, 515, -Parties stipulate to instructions - Hogan statement- with subtraction off 300 and addition on 325
jurors in - 3:02 - Instructions given to Jury- 
3:19  Closing argument - Bednar Clemens
bjb - 3:34 p.m. Closing argument - Hogan
3:41 p.m. - Rebuttal - Bednar Clemens
3:44 p.m. - Final instructions given. Bailiffs sworn. Jurors out for deliberation. Counsel agree no exhibits sent in with jury at this time. 
3:48 p.m. off the record.
4:57 p.m. back on record.  All parties present. Jury present. Verdict read -- defendant not guilty on Ct. 1;  guilty on Ct. 2; guilty on Ct. 3. Court thanks jurors for their time and releases them. Discussion as to sentencing. State requests defendant be remanded immediately. Hogan statement--not prepared for sentencing this date. Court statement--orders defendant into custody; credit will be given between now and time of sentencing. Court finds defendant guilty of bail jumping, Ct. 4. State moves to dismiss 15CM77; granted. Geboy statement--requests delay as to custody. Court statement--defendant remanded. Sentencing  scheduled for 10/8/15 at 3 p.m.

Defendant Mark M. Geboy in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
8:32 - in chambers - motions filed by state - Hogan statement - Bednar statement - Stipulations reached regarding prior convictions of defendant and witness - Discussion regarding count 3 - no reference at this time - defense stipulates to chain of custody at blood draw - and defense stipulates to analyst appearing via video - 
9:06 - all jurors sworn - 20 drawn - 
9:13 - Introduction of counsel - Bendnar - Hogan - Court questions Juror #456 regarding child - Court excuses but advises of further service for November - #1316 draw - 
9:17 - Voir Dire - Court - 
9:24 - Voir Dire - Bednar - 
9:36- Voir DIre- Hogan - 
9:40 - Peremptory strikes commencing - Court gives some instructions to jury - 
9:48    - 12 jurors selected/sworn to serve on trial -  jurors excused - 9:52 - side bar discussion 
10:08 - back on record- Agreement reached regarding count 3- Jurors in - opening statement - Bednar Clemens
10:20  - Opening statement - Hogan
State calls D.V./sworn/direct -witness ID's defendant/Cross by Hogan /redirect/Recross
State calls Sgt Bryan Erickson/sworn/direct - witness IDs defendant -Shows State's exhibit 1(informing the accused) /Cross by Hogan/Redirect 
State calls Deputy David Seefeldt/sworn/direct/ Cross by Hogan /Cross/Redirect
State calls B.N/sworn/Direct - witness IDs defendant /Cross by Hogan /redirect  - side bar
Jurors out at 11:38 - for lunch -  will resume at 1  - off record -back on record- State offers exhibit 1 - recieved - off record

Defendant Mark M. Geboy in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan.  Jodie Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf114 and 15cm77.  Attorney Hogan states there is no resolution and requests a jury trial 15cf114. Bail continued. Jury trial scheduled for September 30, 2015 at 08:30 am. Adj. 2:05 p.m.
State's Exh. 1 (Lab Report)

11:20 a.m. Defendant Mark M. Geboy in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan. Jodie L. Bednar, Asst. D.A., appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Also calling 15CM77.  Hogan states defense will stipulate to 3 prior OWI convictions with the 3rd being within 5 years. State calls Sergeant Brian Erickson, Oneida County Sheriff's Dept., sworn, direct. Witness identifies defendant. State's Exh. 1 (Lab Report) marked, offered, received. Cross by Hogan. Court finds probable cause 4th offiense. Defendant in receipt of Information; waives reading; pleads not guilty to all counts. Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 11, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
no intoxicants, no taverns

03:56 pm - Defendant Mark M. Geboy in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan.  Defendant Mark M. Geboy in custody.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 15cm77 (STC) and 15cf114.  Bednar states witness not available for preliminary hearing today.  State moves to dismiss 15cf114.  Hogan statement to Dismissal.  Bednar motion to modify bond in 15cm77.  Court denies motion to dismiss 15cf114 - Court modifies bond in 15cf114 to $5,000 sig bond.  Defense waives prelim time limits.  Bail continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 9, 2015 at 11:15 am.
no intoxicants, no taverns - if unable to post cash bond, may attend Koinonia inpatient treatment

01:37 pm - Defendant Mark M. Geboy in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan.  Defendant Mark M. Geboy in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 15cf114 and 15cm77 (AIA).    In receipt of complaint, waive reading - set for preliminary hearing.  Schiek/Hogan to bond.  Court sets cash bond.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 04:00 pm.
